snippet: My bedroom has worn carpet. Should I replace it with a hardwood flooring before trying to sell my home?
abstract: Market Ready Q&A offers advice to homeowners on whether to replace worn carpeting in the bedroom with hardwood flooring before trying to sell a home. (M)
lead_paragraph: Q. My bedroom has worn carpet. Should I replace it with a hardwood flooring before trying to sell my home? A. ''Especially in Manhattan, nobody wants a worn anything,'' said Darren Sukenik, a managing director at Prudential Douglas Elliman Real Estate. That applies almost equally to ''people, places or things,'' he said. So ''they certainly don't want worn carpet in a bedroom.''
